node.title: Plexure considers consolidating stock listings after loss
node.description: Marketing software company Plexure has reported a first half loss and removed its full-year sales guidance as it plans to restructure the business.
node.content:
["Marketing software company Plexure has reported a first half loss and removed its full-year sales guidance as it plans to restructure the business.", "", "
Plexure is dual-listed on Australian and New Zealand stock exchanges and may consolidate into one listing in efforts to return to profitability. (file photo) Photo: AFP
", "Company chief executive Daniel Houden, who joined Plexure a month ago, said discussions would focus on returning the company to profitability and would cover customer services and overhead reductions.", "Among the options was to consolidate Plexure, which was currently dual listed on the Australian and New Zealand stock exchanges, into a single listing.", ""Our strategy will focus on delivering better service for our existing customers, faster returns on investment and profitable growth," Houden said.", "The review would also include Plexure's recently acquired Australian e-commerce business Task Retail, which it bought for $AU120m in August, and doubled the size of the group.", "The company said Task's growth had been slowed by an industry-wide supply shortage of hardware, which delayed the rollout of sales and software installations.", "Given the uncertainty, Houden said the company was unable to provide a full-year guidance and dropped its earlier revenue forecast of between $45m and $47m.", "Plexure chair Phil Norman said the board had confidence in the new leadership team to transform the business.", ""The board are positive about the opportunities presented by the merger with Task and are confident that, post transformation, the combined business will have long term benefits for all stakeholders," Norman said."]
